question.title: JSPs and Tomcat Apache 8.5: Session IDs not persisting
question.body:
So in the same server container on Apache Tomcat 8.5 (I got a new laptop from work, this problem wasn't happening on the older desktop), I have one form that calls ajax pages and I put an output of sessionIDs on the form and one of the ajax pages called. The sessionID is the same. I have another form in a different directory calling an ajax page, and outputting the session IDs and everyone is different every time I refresh. And that is what is different now. Every heard of anything like that?

<jsp:useBean id="SSPHelper" class="csd.SSP.SSPHelper" scope="session" /> SSP Reort :6D8B56CA31854AD54B86161EB48F4293 SSP upload :6D8B56CA31854AD54B86161EB48F4293

SSP Reort :6D8B56CA31854AD54B86161EB48F4293 SSP upload :6D8B56CA31854AD54B86161EB48F4293

<jsp:useBean id="objEBCFormHelper" class="csd.formHelpers.EBCFormHelper" scope="session" /> EBC Form :6D8B56CA31854AD54B86161EB48F4293 EBC get saved :E85C2C3559A8344B130A8DD45A38A554 EBC Form :E85C2C3559A8344B130A8DD45A38A554 EBC get saved :246274C371D65E6872CDD5D39C3BF80B

question_comments.body: To be clear, I WANT the jsessionID to remain the same, it has always been like that and something has changed where it's now changing on every call.

Okay, I have figured out that something has changed with the CORS policy on this new laptop that affects relative URLs,  If I state the whole URL then the jSessionID stays the same, so I'm guessing it's CORS police.   When looking this up, I saw a solution there you set the base in javascript (cause I have the <base > tag set) and then you but in this code, and on alerts it shows the whole correct url but still causing new jsessionIDs  .   	$.ajaxSetup({ 	    beforeSend: function(xhr, options) { 	        options.url = baseUrl + options.url; 	        alert( options.url); 	    } 	})
